description:
Allows end-users to customize their settings and get visible status of their Plantronics/Poly audio device on their desktop.

Poly Lens Desktop is an application that enables you to configure and manage your Poly audio and video devices. This app allows you to connect Poly USB devices to the Poly Lens Portal for management and device Insights.
Introduction
Software version: 2.3.0
Release date: September, 2025

What's New
Poly Lens Desktop 2.3.0 includes the following.
- Proxy Configuration: Poly Lens Desktop 2.3 Windows supports Proxy Configuration enabling IT administrators to route application traffic through HTTP(S) proxies using system-wide or per-component settings. See Proxy Configuration for more information (Windows only).
- **Installation Enhancement:**Poly Lens Desktop 2.3 introduces a new installation property for enterprise IT administrators to suppress creation of the desktop shortcut icon during installation. See Installation Enhancement for more information (Windows only).
- Loginless Deployment: Added the support for the application to always start minimized regardless of whether the user is logged in at the time of installation (Windows only).
- HP Thunderbolt 4 G6 Docks Public BETA support for HP Thunderbolt 4 G6 Docks (100W, 180W, 280W) is limited in this release. Please refer to Docking Stations section for more details at Poly Lens Desktop – Supported Devices (Windows only).
- HP Poly Studio A2 Mic Switching: Added support for a setting in Poly Studio V12 that allows mic switching when the Studio A2 Table Microphone is connected.

Resolved Issues
This release includes the following bug fixes.
- Fixed an issue where Call Button Lock setting for Poly Voyager Focus was missing on Poly Lens Cloud (Windows only)
- Fixed an issue regarding ANC/Transparency settings missing on Poly Lens Cloud (Windows only)
- Fixed an issue affecting the call answering behavior on Blackwire 8225 headsets (Windows only)
- Fixed an issue regarding the missing Incoming call for Blackwire 8225 headsets on Poly Lens Desktop and Poly Lens Cloud (Windows only)
- Fixed an issue where Lens Desktop incorrectly displayed an available update for headsets that were already running the latest firmware (Windows only)
- Fixed an issue where Poly Lens Desktop incorrectly appeared offline in the Poly Lens Cloud inventory (Windows only)
- Improved ⁠user experience while setting video favorites on P15 (Windows only)
- Fixed an issue regarding Sensors and Presence missing in Poly Lens Cloud impacting device policies (Mac only)
- Fixed an issue where device update option is not disabled during a call (Mac only)
- Fixed an issue where on-screen alerts for accessibility and Bluetooth are incorrectly displayed upon host or App reboot (Mac only)

Known Issues
This release has the following known issues:
- An issue with the LegacyHost.exe service can cause the Poly Lens Desktop app to slowdown. The service restarts when the issue is detected and requires no user action (Windows only)
- The Frame size and HDR settings on HP 960/965 webcam are reset to previously set value and represented incorrectly unless the camera is reconnected (Mac only)
